ygData.subject: Re: The Future
ygData.msgSnippet: I probably should build when the time comes. I just remember building in the 80 s. IRQ conflicts. Cheap products (I built from crap and scrap). It was fun
ygData.messageBody:
I probably should build when the time comes. I just remember building
in the 80's. IRQ conflicts. Cheap products (I built from crap and
scrap). It was fun then. So was working on my own car.

Not the same so many years later. Especially reading horror stories
of component losses due to improperly mounted heat sinks and bad heat
management.

Still, I would get just the machine I want, designed specifically for
gaming. I really should do it.

Barto

--- In EverQuest@yahoogroups.com, "Dawn" <dlb@p...> wrote:
> I build my own machines and run EQ very well. The price is way
less than
> $1700 and they are fully upgradeable :) I recently built one for
my husband
> so that we could play together. Case, 19" monitor, keyboard,
optical mouse,
> motherboard w/ AMD 1.3 processor, Audigy MP3 sound card, GEforce 3
video
> card, 512 megs of ram, 60 gig hard drive, CD/RW drive and
speakers.....
> around $1000. There are also advantages to being able to load only
the
> software you want on a blank hard drive.
>
> It's really not hard to build your own :)
>
> Kanalyn 25 Druid
> Allilee 18 Ranger
> Jenayla 6 Shaman
> Tarew Marr
